data

Class DataTrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.DataTrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Data

    public class DataTrain
extends java.lang.Object
implements Data
    The class DataTrain is an implementation of the interface Data that handles with the training data file.
    Author:
    Nuno Mendes, Sofia Silva, Tiago Ricardo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataTrain(java.lang.String url)
      The constructor creates an element of the type DataTrain that includes the number or random variables, the number of events and a 2-D array of type TimeSample.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[][] get()
      The method get() iterates over an ArrayList that includes the data read from the input files in order to put it into an array of integers.
      int[][] getInitData(java.lang.String url)
      The method getInitData() allows access to all the values of the random variables at the time instant 0.
      java.lang.String[] getNames()
      The method allows the user to access the names of the random variables.
      int getNumVA()
      The method returns the number of random variables.
      int getSize()
      The method returns the number of events.
      java.lang.String toString()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataTrain

        public DataTrain(java.lang.String url)
          throws java.io.IOException
        The constructor creates an element of the type DataTrain that includes the number or random variables, the number of events and a 2-D array of type TimeSample.
        Parameters:
        url - String with the URL of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - It throws an IOException when the file does not exist.
        See Also:
        TimeSample, Event

    • Method Detail

      • getInitData

        public int[][] getInitData(java.lang.String url)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        The method getInitData() allows access to all the values of the random variables at the time instant 0.
        Parameters:
        url - String with the URL of the file
        Returns:
        datainit The values of the random variables at time instant 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - It throws an IOException when the file does not exist.

        TimeSample, Event

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • get

        public int[][] get()
        The method get() iterates over an ArrayList that includes the data read from the input files in order to put it into an array of integers. In the case of the training data, the array is bi-dimensional and it's two columns are relative to the values of the random variables in time-slices t and t+1, respectively.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Data
        Returns:
        data Array of integers with the data retrieved from the input files.

      • getNames

        public java.lang.String[] getNames()
        The method allows the user to access the names of the random variables. This access is made through an array of Strings with the data from the input files.
        Specified by:
        getNames in interface Data
        Returns:
        names Array of strings with the names of the random variables.

      • getNumVA

        public int getNumVA()
        The method returns the number of random variables.
        Specified by:
        getNumVA in interface Data
        Returns:
        num_va Number of Random Variables

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The method returns the number of events.
        Specified by:
        getSize in interface Data
        Returns:
        size Number of Events.
